body: I felt frozen to my seat, anger making my hands shake. When I was younger, I used to only cry when I was absolutely furious, and I blinked back tears in my eyes that hadn’t come in <CHOICE(A)> Even in the moment, I couldn’t tell what I was thinking. My mind didn’t produce lucid thoughts, but only covered my eyes in a veil of hot red. My ears filled with static. My hands were suddenly up over my closed eyes, like they were going to suffocate the scalding rage.
